page.title: 10East Dean's Local History
page.content: All Saints church in East Dean dates from 1150 A.D. and is in the shape of a cross,inpressive in its simplicity, it has plain windows and little ornamentation Some Bronze age round Barrows have been found in the area. Fox Hall, Charlton, with its tall chimneys, royal bedroom with fine panelling and great fireplace was built in 1730 by the Duke of Richmond as a hunting lodge in connection with the famous Charlton Hunt. Goodwood Racecourse has existed for nearly 200 years. In the Middle ages East Dean Park was a deer park of the Earls of Arundel but few traces still remain. The two lodges at Pilley Green are now used as private houses. To the north east and south west of Pilley Green are Tumulus sites.
